meanings.definition: The act of carrying out a task clumsily or incompetently.
meanings.sent1: His bunglings in the kitchen resulted in a burnt dinner.
meanings.sent2: The team's bunglings led to a failed project deadline.
meanings.sent3: Despite his bunglings, he always managed to make people laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her bunglings were like a comedy of errors unfolding before our eyes.
meanings.sent5: The bunglings of the new employee quickly became the talk of the office.

meanings.definition: A series of mistakes or errors made while attempting to complete a task.
meanings.sent1: The manager was frustrated by the constant bunglings of his team.
meanings.sent2: She tried to fix the bunglings in the report before the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The bunglings in the play rehearsal added an unexpected twist to the performance.
meanings.sent4: The bunglings in her speech made it more memorable than if it had been perfect.
meanings.sent5: His bunglings were like a trail of breadcrumbs leading to the solution.
